thread.title_full: Men's basketball | Former Louisville assistant resigns at Missouri-KC | Buckeye Xtra Sports

title: Men's basketball | Former Louisville assistant resigns at Missouri-KC | Buckeye Xtra Sports
text:
Andre McGee resigned as assistant coach at the University of Missouri-Kansas City on Friday, saying he could no longer do the job as he fights “false” allegations by an escort that he hired dancers to strip and have sex with recruits and players while coaching at Louisville.
Rick Pitino — his former boss at Louisville — said in a statement soon after that he is going to skip the Atlantic Coast Conference’s media day next week in Charlotte, N.C., on the advice of counsel because of the allegations.
In his resignation letter to UMKC athletics director Carla Wilson, McGee said he couldn’t perform his duties as a coach for the Kangaroos while also dealing with the allegations in Louisville.
>> Get the most out of your Ohio State experience, follow @BuckeyeXtra on Twitter
